citations.narrative:
The cement pond for the 11 ducks has a dark green color with accumulations of algae growth. Leaves and other organic
matter continue to accumulate in the pond. Particulate matter must be removed from the pond as often as necessary to
maintain the water quality. Licensee must establish and maintain a program to remove organic matter and debris
including draining pond when necessary to maintain the water quality for the ducks.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There were accumulations of excreta and soiled bedding inside several of the elevated chicken shelters. Excreta and
soiled bedding must be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive accumulations of
feces, odors, and to reduce disease risks such as respiratory infections. Failure to remove excreta and soiled bedding can
increase disease risks, odors, and pest problems. Licensee must ensure animals shelters are kept clean to prevent
accumulations of excreta, soiled bedding, and odors.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Pest control. Rodent holes, tunnels, and rodent droppings were present inside some of the enclosures housing the
chickens. There were rodent feces inside some of green wooden feeders for the chickens and inside some of the empty
green chicken boxes in the middle enclosure. Rodent bait was present in some of the rodent holes and in some of the
empty green chicken boxes, but additional measures are necessary to control rodents. Rodents and rodent droppings can
expose the chickens to disease risks and contaminate food supplies, nesting boxes, and other surfaces. Licensee must
establish and maintain an effective program for the control of rodents to protect the health of the birds. Correct by April 23,
2025
This inspection was conducted with the facility representative and the avian attending veterinarian and the exit interview
was conducted with the facility representative.
